thread.title: Liverpool keen to beat Manchester United to teenage Nottingham Forest star Ben Brereton
thread.title_full: Liverpool keen to beat Manchester United to teenage Nottingham Forest star Ben Brereton

author: Adrian Kajumba
title: Liverpool keen to beat Manchester United to teenage Nottingham Forest star Ben Brereton
text:
Liverpool keen to beat Manchester United to teenage Nottingham Forest star Ben Brereton The 17-year-old underlined his potential with a dramatic injury-time winner against Aston Villa Share Ben Brereton celebrates scoring his winning volley against Aston Villa (Photo: Rex Features)   Thank you for subscribing!   
Liverpool are determined to win the race for Nottingham Forest 's latest hot prospect Ben Brereton. 
Strike starlet Brereton, 17, underlined his potential with a dramatic injury-time winner against Aston Villa to open his Forest account on Saturday. 
Liverpool had a Â£2.5million approach for the Brereton rejected late in the January transfer window. 
They will continue to monitor the teenager, who is also attracting interest from Manchester United , with a view to a summer move. The teenager has attracted attention from Liverpool and Manchester United (Photo: Rex Features) Forest lost Oliver Burke to RB Leipzig last summer (Photo: REUTERS) 
Liverpool have earmarked him as one for future and want him to join Ben Woodburn, 16, as a teenage striker on their books. 
Forest sold winger Oliver Burke, 19, to Red Bull Leipzig last summer and are facing a battle to hold on to two more academy starlets this year. 
As well as Brereton, Chelsea and Red Bull Leipzig are battling it out for 19-year-old midfielder Matty Cash. poll loading Will Nottingham Forest lose Brereton in the summer? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
